name: Cornmeal Flour
description: Cornmeal flour made from finely ground corn, ideal for making cornbread, polenta, or as a thickening agent for sauces.

name: Sweet Corn
description: Sweet corn, harvested at peak ripeness, perfect for salads, soups, and snacks. It can be consumed fresh or preserved.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Premium quality Basmati rice with long grains, ideal for biryanis, pilafs, and other aromatic rice dishes.

name: Sona Masoori Rice
description: Sona Masoori rice, a medium-grain rice, commonly used in South Indian cuisine for making dosas, idlis, and daily meals.

name: Jasmine Rice
description: Fragrant jasmine rice with long grains, often used in Thai and South Asian dishes like stir-fries and curries.

name: Toor Dal
description: Toor Dal, also known as pigeon peas, commonly used in Indian curries and dals, rich in protein and essential nutrients.

name: Chana Dal
description: Chana dal, split chickpeas, are widely used in Indian cooking for making dals, soups, and savory snacks.

name: Masoor Dal
description: Red lentils that cook quickly and are a key ingredient in Indian dals, soups, and stews. They are mild and easy to digest.

name: Moong Dal
description: Yellow split moong dal, perfect for making light dals or as a base for soups and stews. Known for its digestibility.

name: Black Urad Dal
description: Black urad dal, commonly used to prepare Indian dishes like dal makhani and dosa batter, packed with protein and fiber.

name: Wheat Flour
description: Whole wheat flour, ground from whole wheat grains, commonly used for making flatbreads, rotis, and other baked goods.

name: Oats
description: Oats, a versatile cereal grain, commonly used for breakfast porridges, baking, and adding texture to dishes.

name: Barley
description: Barley, an ancient grain, used in soups, stews, salads, and as a healthier substitute for rice or wheat.

name: Millets
description: Millets are small, nutritious grains that are gluten-free and can be used in porridge, baked goods, or as a rice substitute.

name: Black Pepper
description: Black pepper, known as the 'king of spices,' is used to add heat and flavor to a variety of dishes.

name: Star Anise
description: Star anise, a fragrant spice with a licorice flavor, commonly used in Indian and Chinese cooking.

name: Carom (Ajwain)
description: Ajwain seeds, known for their sharp, bitter flavor, often used in Indian cooking for flavoring parathas and curries.

name: Fennel (Saunf)
description: Fennel seeds, known for their sweet and licorice-like flavor, commonly used in Indian sweets and savory dishes.

name: Cinnamon (Dalchini)
description: Cinnamon, a fragrant spice that adds warmth and depth to both sweet and savory dishes.

name: Fenugreek (Methi)
description: Fenugreek seeds, used in Indian cooking to add a slightly bitter and nutty flavor to curries and dals.

name: Asafoetida (Hing)
description: Asafoetida, a pungent spice used in small quantities to enhance the flavor of dals, curries, and vegetable dishes.

name: Green Cardamom (Ilayachi)
description: Green cardamom, known for its sweet, aromatic flavor, used in Indian sweets, teas, and spice blends.

name: Cumin (Jira)
description: Cumin seeds, known for their warm and earthy flavor, essential in Indian and Middle Eastern cuisine.

name: Turmeric (Haldi)
description: Turmeric, a bright yellow spice, known for its earthy flavor and health benefits, widely used in curries.

name: Chili Powder
description: Spicy and pungent chili powder, a blend of ground dried chilies, used in Indian cooking to add heat and color to dishes.

name: Cumin Powder
description: Ground cumin, known for its earthy and slightly smoky flavor, essential for curries, soups, and spice blends.

name: Coriander Powder
description: Coriander powder, made from ground coriander seeds, offers a mild, citrusy flavor, widely used in Indian curries.

name: Mustard Seeds
description: Mustard seeds, used to temper dals, curries, and other Indian dishes, providing a pungent and aromatic flavor.

name: Cloves
description: Whole cloves, a staple in Indian cooking, used to add warmth and depth to biryanis, curries, and spice blends.

name: Bay Leaves
description: Bay leaves, used in Indian dishes like biryani and curries to infuse a subtle herbal aroma and flavor.

name: Dimond Jewellery
description: Elegant diamond-like imitation jewellery, crafted to resemble authentic diamond pieces with intricate detailing.

name: Antique Jewellery
description: Beautiful antique-style imitation jewellery, inspired by vintage designs with a timeless appeal.

name: Polki Jewellery
description: Polki-style imitation jewellery, showcasing traditional craftsmanship with a luxurious look.

name: Brass Jewellery
description: Stylish brass imitation jewellery, perfect for making a bold fashion statement with durability.

name: Copper Jewellery
description: Chic copper imitation jewellery, offering a warm tone and versatile style for various occasions.

name: Matt Jewellery
description: Elegant matte finish imitation jewellery, providing a contemporary look with understated elegance.

name: Urid Papad
description: A traditional and crispy snack made from urid dal, perfect as an accompaniment to meals or as a standalone treat.

name: Nagali Papad
description: Nutritious and crunchy papad made from ragi (finger millet), a healthy addition to your meals.

name: Rice Papad
description: Light and crispy papad crafted from rice flour, offering a delicate and delightful flavor.

name: Potato Papad
description: Tasty and crunchy snack made from Potato and flour, enjoyed for its unique flavor.

name: Kurdai
description: Handmade traditional snack made from wheat flour, enjoyed for its unique texture and taste.
